How I Tackled Rheumatoid Arthritis and Got My Life Back

For as long as I can remember I have been a hustler. Working 2 jobs at once had been the norm for me ever since I was just a boy. As I grew older I thought that I would become less active but that was not the case.

When I was 30 years old I was still working two jobs but this time it was out of choice. I was a construction foreman and managed a construction crew of 30. I spent the rest of my time helping my wife run her food blog.

I never thought I would take part in operating a food blog, but I got to say she has made some real serious money off the thing!

And on top of that, it was another excuse to spend time with my wife while still keeping busy like I always had

Life was good

Until, one day at the construction site I noticed a very random sharp pain in a few of my fingers. This pain happened every now and then in both of my hands at random times. This time was different though.

The pain was a lot sharper and it didn’t go away.

I ignored it for a couple of days until my fingers were literally misshapen and swollen.

My wife demanded that we go to the hospital and get them looked at immediately. At that hospital in that same day I was diagnosed with what the doctor called RA, which was short for Rheumatoid Arthritis

What I didn’t know was how that was going to change my life forever. I thought that this RA was going to be treated the same way doctors treat everything. Give me some pills and let them work their magic. But I was so wrong.

I proceeded on with my busy life normally for a while but the arthritis continued to bother me.

The pain was so bad but I did my best to ignore it. There eventually became no way I could even help my wife with her business anymore which was killing me.

On top of that people were starting to ask me about my swollen and misshapen fingers at work. It honestly felt like the pain grew worse as time went on.

I remember it had probably been a year since I had first been diagnosed when I realized, “wow, this is never going to go away”.

That’s when I had the idea to figure out a way to live with rheumatoid arthritis. I started doing research on ways to ease the pain and told myself I would try them all until I found something.

I tried every natural remedy out there, I tried several different medications, I even had fusion surgeries to have pain relieved.

I couldn’t find anything that had a lasting effect and everything I tried had cost a fortune.

I was just about ready to give up and accept that I may have to deal with this for the rest of my life until I stumbled across something online.

I was shopping for household items online when I saw a very interesting flavor of coffee. It was labeled Nutrapod Golden Milk blend.

What was interesting about this coffee was the ingredients. it was filled with nutrients that are said to provide numerous benefits!

The coffee included Coffee, coconut milk, turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, honey, Vitamin D, Calcium, Iron, Lucuma, Potassium, maca root powder

I scanned through the list of benefits, and once I saw that “reduces inflammation” as well as “arthritis support” I ordered it immediately. I knew that there was a small chance of this working so I did not get my hopes up.

A few days later I was getting ready for work early in the morning when I looked down at my hands, they were not swollen at all but I could feel the pain start to creep.

I opened the door to head to work and looked down and saw a package for me.

I completely forgot that I had ordered the Nutrapod golden blend coffee. I picked up the box and retreated back inside to make a cup.

I made one cup and drank it on the way to work and I must say that it was truly delicious. Even if the stuff didn’t end up working, I was definitely going to keep ordering more.

I drank a cup every morning and sometimes some during the day when I was feeling a little drowsy and I gotta say I felt somewhat back to the way things used to be.

Every now and then it hurt a little but it was looking like the coffee had helped my symptoms tremendously.

The doctor told me different peoples bodies respond to different treatments but never did I think coffee would be the answer.

I ordered more immediately and have been drinking Nutrapod Golden Milk since. If you or you know someone who has had a hard time finding a solution, I highly recommend giving Nutrapod Golden blend a try!
